description: Cedar Garden is a family-owned Lebanese restaurant serving classic mezze, charcoal-grilled kebabs, shawarma, and traditional desserts in a warm, casual setting.

location_info.parking: Shared parking lot in front of the plaza with overflow parking along Cedar Grove Ave.
location_info.landmarks: Located in Cedar Grove Plaza near the intersection of Chapman Ave and State College Blvd, next to a Starbucks and across from a Target.
location_info.entrance_notes: Main entrance faces the plaza parking lot. Side entrance available for takeout pickup.

menu_sections.name: Cold Mezze
menu_sections.description: Traditional Lebanese cold appetizers, perfect for sharing.

items.name: Hummus
items.description: Creamy chickpea and tahini dip topped with olive oil and paprika, served with warm pita.

items.name: Baba Ghanoush
items.description: Smoky roasted eggplant dip with tahini, lemon, and garlic, served with warm pita.

items.name: Labneh
items.description: Strained yogurt spread topped with olive oil and mint, served with pita bread.

items.name: Grape Leaves (Warak Enab)
items.description: Vine leaves stuffed with rice, tomatoes, onions, and herbs. Served chilled with lemon.

items.name: Moutabbal
items.description: Eggplant and tahini dip blended smooth, finished with pomegranate seeds and olive oil.

menu_sections.name: Hot Mezze
menu_sections.description: Hot appetizers and small plates, great for sharing or starting your meal.

items.name: Falafel
items.description: Crispy chickpea fritters served with tahini sauce and pickles.

items.name: Fried Kibbeh
items.description: Cracked wheat shells stuffed with seasoned ground beef, onions, and pine nuts, deep-fried until crispy.

items.name: Spicy Potatoes (Batata Harra)
items.description: Crispy potatoes tossed with garlic, cilantro, chili, and lemon.

items.name: Halloumi Grill
items.description: Grilled halloumi cheese served with tomatoes, cucumbers, and olives.

items.name: Tabbouleh
items.description: Chopped parsley, mint, tomatoes, onions, and fine bulgur tossed with lemon and olive oil.

items.name: Fattoush
items.description: Mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumbers, radishes, onions, and toasted pita chips in a tangy sumac dressing.

items.name: Mediterranean Chicken Salad
items.description: Grilled marinated chicken over mixed greens with tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, and feta cheese.

menu_sections.name: Wraps & Sandwiches
menu_sections.description: Stuffed in pita or saj bread, served with fries or salad.

items.name: Chicken Shawarma Wrap
items.description: Thinly sliced marinated chicken, garlic sauce, pickles, and lettuce in warm pita.

items.name: Beef Shawarma Wrap
items.description: Spiced beef slices, tahini sauce, onions, and tomatoes in pita.

items.name: Falafel Wrap
items.description: Falafel, hummus, tomatoes, pickles, and tahini sauce in pita.

items.name: Kafta Wrap
items.description: Ground beef and lamb kafta, onions, parsley, and tahini in pita.

menu_sections.name: Grill & Entrees
menu_sections.description: Charcoal-grilled kebabs, plates, and traditional Lebanese mains.

items.name: Mixed Grill Plate
items.description: Combination of chicken kabob, beef kabob, and kafta, served with rice, grilled vegetables, and garlic sauce.

items.name: Chicken Kabob Plate
items.description: Charcoal-grilled marinated chicken skewers served with rice, salad, and garlic sauce.

items.name: Beef Kabob Plate
items.description: Grilled beef skewers with rice, grilled vegetables, and tahini sauce.

items.name: Lamb Chops
items.description: Charcoal-grilled lamb chops with herb marinade, served with rice and grilled vegetables.

items.name: Mujadara Plate
items.description: Lentils and rice cooked with caramelized onions, served with salad and yogurt on the side.

menu_sections.name: Family Trays
menu_sections.description: Large-format trays for families and small gatherings (takeout or catering).

items.name: Mixed Grill Tray
items.description: Serves 6–8: chicken, beef, and kafta skewers, rice, grilled vegetables, hummus, and garlic sauce.

items.name: Mezze Party Tray
items.description: Serves 8–10: hummus, baba ghanoush, grape leaves, falafel, tabbouleh, fattoush, and pita.

items.name: Baklava
items.description: Layers of phyllo, walnuts, and honey syrup.

items.name: Knafeh
items.description: Warm sweet cheese dessert topped with shredded phyllo and syrup.

items.name: Rice Pudding (Riz Bi Haleeb)
items.description: Creamy rice pudding with cinnamon and pistachios.

items.name: Soft Drinks
items.description: Coke, Diet Coke, Sprite, and other assorted sodas. Free refills for dine-in.

items.name: Mint Lemonade
items.description: Freshly squeezed lemonade blended with mint.

items.name: Ayran (Yogurt Drink)
items.description: Savory yogurt drink with a touch of salt.

items.name: Turkish Coffee
items.description: Strong, finely ground coffee served in the traditional style.

items.name: Hot Tea
items.description: Black tea or mint tea, served with sugar on the side.

specials.name: Lunch Shawarma Combo
specials.description: Monday–Friday 11:00 am – 3:00 pm: any shawarma wrap with fries and a soft drink for 14.99.

specials.name: Family Mixed Grill Night
specials.description: Family-style mixed grill platter for four with rice, salad, and mezze for 69.99.

specials.name: Mezze Monday
specials.description: 20% off all mezze plates on Mondays for dine-in only.

faq.question: Do you take reservations?
faq.answer: Yes, we take reservations for parties of 2 to 10 guests. Larger parties should call in advance so we can discuss options.

faq.question: How can I make a reservation?
faq.answer: You can make a reservation by calling us at (714) 555-8734. Online reservations may be added in the future.

faq.question: What are your hours?
faq.answer: We are open Monday through Thursday from 11:00 am to 9:00 pm, Friday and Saturday from 11:00 am to 10:00 pm, and Sunday from 12:00 pm to 8:30 pm.

faq.question: Are you halal?
faq.answer: Yes, we serve halal meat. If you have any specific concerns, please ask and we can guide you to suitable options.

faq.question: Do you have vegetarian or vegan options?
faq.answer: Yes, we have many vegetarian and several vegan options, especially in our mezze and salads. Dishes like hummus, baba ghanoush, grape leaves, tabbouleh, fattoush, falafel, and mujadara are popular choices.

faq.question: Do you offer gluten-free options?
faq.answer: Yes, several of our grilled plates, salads, and some mezze items are naturally gluten-free or can be prepared without bread. Please inform your server about any gluten sensitivities.

faq.question: Do you offer catering or party trays?
faq.answer: Yes, we offer catering and large party trays for events, including mixed grill and mezze trays. Most orders require 24–48 hours’ notice depending on size.

faq.question: Do you have a private room for events?
faq.answer: Yes, we have a private banquet room that can host up to 30 guests and a semi-private patio area. Please call for availability and details.

faq.question: Is there parking available?
faq.answer: Yes, there is a shared parking lot in front of the restaurant and additional parking along Cedar Grove Ave.

faq.question: Can I bring an outside cake?
faq.answer: Yes, you can bring an outside cake for celebrations. A small plating fee may apply. Please ask your server for details.

faq.question: Do you have a kids menu?
faq.answer: We do not have a separate kids menu, but we can make smaller portions of kabobs, shawarma, and pasta dishes for children at a reduced price.

faq.question: Can you accommodate large groups?
faq.answer: Yes, we can accommodate large groups with advance notice. For parties of 10 or more, please call us to discuss seating and timing.

policies.reservations: Reservations are recommended for weekends and large groups, but walk-ins are always welcome when space is available.
policies.large_parties: Parties of 8 or more may be subject to an 18% automatic gratuity. For parties of 10 or more, we recommend calling ahead to confirm availability.
policies.cancellation: For standard reservations, we appreciate at least 2 hours’ notice. For large parties, 24–48 hours’ notice is preferred.
policies.dress_code: Casual attire is welcome. We simply ask that guests wear shirts and shoes.
policies.outside_food: Outside cakes are allowed for celebrations; a small plating fee may apply. Outside beverages are not permitted.
policies.gratuity: An 18% service charge may be added to parties of 8 or more.
policies.pets: Only service animals are permitted inside. Well-behaved dogs may be allowed on the patio where local regulations permit.
policies.accessibility: The main dining room, patio, and restrooms are wheelchair accessible.
policies.takeout: Most items are available for takeout. You can order by phone, online, or through our delivery partners.

rewards_program.name: Cedar Rewards
rewards_program.description: Earn 1 point for every dollar spent. 100 points = $5 off your next visit.

ai_persona.tone_of_voice: warm, welcoming, respectful, and slightly casual while staying professional
ai_persona.escalation_policy: For anything uncertain, unavailable, or involving refunds, large catering orders, or private events, the assistant should politely offer to connect the caller with a staff member or ask them to call during business hours to speak with a manager.
